author: phucthai
content: I am trying to launch a shadow fork but the shadow fork nodes drop connections with other nodes as the received "invalid" blocks. Can we change the config to avoid this? Or we need to change the code?

author: parithosh
content: They stay peered for some duration, the exact duration depends on the clients themselves. But after a point, its inevitable that they unpeer. In the end you do have an invalid chain when compared to the canonical network and the canonical network should not get spammed by your txs/blocks.

author: phucthai
content: Then how can we use the transactions in the canonical network for the shadow fork?

author: parithosh
content: as long as you stay peered, usually in our tests its like < 3 days, you'll continue importing txs. Once you unpeer, no more txs. Shadowforks are short term tests to check a certain fork/behaviour. They aren't meant to be long term things. You could use tools like this one if you want to extend the lifespan: https://github.com/ethpandaops/mempool-bridge
